message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with a communication problem involving a server and clients, which is a common topic in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The problem involves minimizing the number of broadcast transmissions, which is a combinatorial optimization problem and falls under the scope of the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also proposes a decoding criterion and provides a probabilistic analysis, which are techniques commonly used in the Signal Processing (cs.SI) and Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-categories.
